task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 290°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building’s height accurately I need to see the roofline and ground reference, so I should tilt the camera up while keeping the building centered.
The view is now facing north rather than toward the target building at ~290°, so I should rotate left to bring the west-northwest building back into frame.
I’m back on the target heading but need the roofline and base together, so I should tilt up to capture the top of the main façade.
The camera is again facing north, so I should rotate to ~290° while keeping the upward pitch to see the building’s top.
Rather than repeatedly losing the heading, I should keep heading 290° and pitch up to include the roofline for height estimation.
The view keeps snapping to 0° after pitching, so I should explicitly rotate back to heading 290° while staying pitched up.
To avoid the heading reset, I should use a single custom rotation that sets both yaw and pitch toward the building’s roofline.
Since pitching up forces heading to 0°, I should now rotate left to heading ~290° (i.e., -70°) while keeping pitch at 20° to view the building top.
I still need a stable view including both base and roof, so I’ll move closer to improve scale cues and then estimate from façade levels.
